The reason is an in-built technology of Final Cut Pro. Every professional video editing software has own codecs. We are using this Codec concept for Offline & Online Editing process, otherwise called Proxy Workflow. For example, Avid Media Composer has DN*HD Codec. Similarly, FCP has ProRes Codec. ProRes codec is developed by Apple. If you want to edit video in FCP. Your video must want to be in ProRes otherwise they will automatically convert your video on ProRes when import to FCP. After the edit, you can easily export your video on ProRes Codec. But Officially in windows, we couldn’t export videos on ProRes. Likely we have alternate with third-party plugins called “Prores on Windows”. But this plugin has some lacking like image quality issues, Don’t offer support, Errors, Etc. So only FCP only available on MAC.
